title: Exploratory Data Analysis
description: OverviewWelcome to the 2018 RSNA Challenge co-hosted by Kaggle. In this competition, the primary endpoint will be the detection of bounding boxes corresponding to the diagnosis of pneumonia (e.g. lung infection) on chest radiographs, a special 2D high resolution grayscale medical image. Note that pnuemonia is just one of many possible disease processes that can occur on a chest radiograph, and that any given single image may contain 0, 1 or many boxes corresponding to possible pneumonia locations. My name is Peter Chang, MD. I am both a radiologist physician and a data scientist / software engineer with machine learning experience. Today, in this Jupyter notebook, we will explore the 2018 RSNA Challenge dataset including underlying data structures, imaging file formats and label types.
